text: <a href="../2-Corinthians-8-1/" title="2 Corinthians 8:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-2/" title="2 Corinthians 8:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-3/" title="2 Corinthians 8:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 For to *their* power, I bear record, yea, and beyond *their* power *they were* willing of themselves;

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-4/" title="2 Corinthians 8:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and *take upon us* the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-5/" title="2 Corinthians 8:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And *this they did*, not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-6/" title="2 Corinthians 8:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-7/" title="2 Corinthians 8:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Therefore, as ye abound in every *thing, in* faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and *in* all diligence, and *in* your love to us, *see* that ye abound in this grace also.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-8/" title="2 Corinthians 8:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-9/" title="2 Corinthians 8:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-10/" title="2 Corinthians 8:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 And herein I give *my* advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-11/" title="2 Corinthians 8:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Now therefore perform the doing *of it*; that as *there was* a readiness to will, so *there may be* a performance also out of that which ye have.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-12/" title="2 Corinthians 8:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 For if there be first a willing mind, *it is* accepted according to that a man hath, *and* not according to that he hath not.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-13/" title="2 Corinthians 8:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 For *I mean* not that other men be eased, and ye burdened:

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-14/" title="2 Corinthians 8:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 But by an equality, *that* now at this time your abundance *may be a supply* for their want, that their abundance also may be *a supply* for your want: that there may be equality:

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-15/" title="2 Corinthians 8:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 As it is written, He that *had gathered* much had nothing over; and he that *had gathered* little had no lack.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-16/" title="2 Corinthians 8:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 But thanks *be* to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-17/" title="2 Corinthians 8:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-18/" title="2 Corinthians 8:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise *is* in the gospel throughout all the churches;

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-19/" title="2 Corinthians 8:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 And not *that* only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and *declaration of* your ready mind:

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-20/" title="2 Corinthians 8:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 Avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-21/" title="2 Corinthians 8:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-22/" title="2 Corinthians 8:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which *I have* in you.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-23/" title="2 Corinthians 8:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 Whether *any do enquire* of Titus, *he is* my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren *be enquired of, they are* the messengers of the churches, *and* the glory of Christ.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-8-24/" title="2 Corinthians 8:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.
